page.title: 18SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: The Future With more and more mechanisation on farms,there are few job opportunities in the area. Only 5% of the population finds employment in Edington, working on the farms,in one of three small industrial workshops or in the shops and public houses. Many need personal transport to work further afield, and two people actually commute to London each day -110 miles away! With the rising cost of transport, the village is being vacated by the working community, leaving the unemployed or, even more so,the retired.This is causing an imbalance of population which threatens the lives of the shops, Post Office and village school. This will eventually result in a small cross-section of society being able to afford,or wishing,to live here.
